id-00001.desc: The sliver makes two claw attacks.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8+ 3) slashing damage.

spellskite.name: Spellskite
spellskite.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
spellskite.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak.

id-00001.name: Immutable Form
id-00001.desc: The spellskite is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

id-00002.name: Magic Resistance
id-00002.desc: The spellskite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00003.name: Magic Ward
id-00003.desc: The spellskite has resistance to damage from spells.

id-00004.name: Redirect Spells
id-00004.desc: Whenever a spell is cast within 120 feet of the Spellskite that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self or touch, the Spellskite magically redirects the spell and becomes the target. If the spell could not normally affect the spellskite, the spell fails. The creator of the spellskite can designate creatures that won't be affected by this trait.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d8+1) piercing damage.

id-00001.name: Keen Smell
id-00001.desc: The boar has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

id-00002.name: Charge
id-00002.desc: If the boar moves at least 20 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a tusk attack on the same turn, the target takes an extra 9 (2d8) slashing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 14 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00003.name: Regeneration
id-00003.desc: The boar regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the boar takes acid or fire damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the boar's next turn. The boar dies only is it starts its turn with 0 hit points and doesn't regenerate.

id-00001.name: Tusk
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) slashing damage.

id-00001.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00001.desc: The guardian's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save DC 15, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The guardian can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: Druidcraft, thorn whip (11th level) 3/day each: spike growth, silence 1/day each: conjure animals, plant growth

id-00002.name: Keen hearing and Smell
id-00002.desc: The guardian has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

id-00003.name: Speak with Beasts and Plants
id-00003.desc: The guardian can communicate with beasts and plants as if they shared a language.

id-00004.name: Tree Stride
id-00004.desc: Once on its turn, the guardian can use 10 feet of its movement to step magically into one living tree within its reach and emerge from a second living tree within 60 feet of the first tree, appearing in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the second tree. Both trees must be Large or bigger.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The guardian makes two bite attacks.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

text.p: A manifestation of nature's own self-defense, the Grove Guardian travels through the wilderness, protecting the land and its inhabitants. Taking the shape of a wolf, the Grove Guardian uses its fangs and powerful magic to drive away anything that threatens its land.

Neutral Guardians. Grove Guardians do not think of things in terms of right or wrong, nor do they care for law. Emerging to protect the land it has been bound to, a Grove Guardian attacks all with zealous animosity. Only those who can convince it of their desire to protect the land are left alone. Druids are recognized by Grove Guardians but not exempted from their judgment, having to prove their loyalty to nature before a Guardian will ignore them.

Silent Sentinels. Prior to attacking, Grove Guardians will make their presence known to outsiders. If outsiders do not demonstrate proper respect to the land or fail to acknowledge Grove Guardians in communication, the Guardians will attack.

Force of Nature. The land calls Grove Guardians to its aid. Their numbers increase according to the danger of the situation. Often only one Guardian will be called in defense against wandering outsiders, but a whole pack may appear in the wake of cataclysmic events.

burningskeleton.name: Burning Skeleton
burningskeleton.languages: under stands all languages it knew in life but can't speak.

id-00001.name: Heated Body
id-00001.desc: A creature that touches the skeleton or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 3 (1d6) fire damage.

id-00002.name: Heated Weapons
id-00002.desc: Any weapon the skeleton wields deals an extra 3 (1d6) fire damage on a hit (included in the attack).

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The skeleton makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Shortsword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

id-00003.name: Shortbow
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 80/320 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

id-00001.name: Alien Mind
id-00001.desc: The monitor has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The monitor makes two fist attacks.

id-00002.name: Fist
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 21 (3d10 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Constrict
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5)bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 16). Until this grapple ends, the creature is restrained, and the monitor can't constrict another target.

id-00004.name: Spawn Scion (3/day)
id-00004.desc: The monitor spawns an eldrazi scion that appears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of it.

id-00001.name: Alien Mind
id-00001.desc: The scion has advantage on Wisdom saving throws.

id-00001.name: Tentacles
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it is grappled (escape DC 16). Until the grapple ends, the target is restrained, and the scion can't use its tentacles on another target.

covenhorror.name: Coven Horror
covenhorror.damageresistances: cold, fire; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered

id-00001.name: Wails of the Unborn
id-00001.desc: Humanoids within 60 feet of the horror that can hear it have disadvantage on Constitution saving throws to maintain concentration.

id-00002.name: Magic Resistance
id-00002.desc: The horror has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The horror can use its Gaze. It then makes two claw attacks.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

id-00003.name: Gaze
id-00003.desc: The horror makes one gaze at random, choosing one target it can see within 60 feet of it 1.

id-00004.desc: Gaze of Agony. The target creature must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw, taking 36 (8d8) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00005.desc: Gaze of Lethargy. The target creature must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target can't use reactions, its speed is halved, and it can't make more than one attack on its turn. In addition, the target can take either an action or a bonus action on its turn, not both. These effects last for 1 minute. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00006.desc: Gaze of Despair. The target creature must succeed on a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes overwhelmed with despair for 1 minute, and has disadvantage on attack rolls, saving throws, and ability checks. The creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

p.i: "I shuddered at their wailing and cackling. This was true evil, all three heads bickering on the best way to kill my friends as I cried behind the rock." - Camus, Former Caravan Guard

text.p: Hags represent all that is evil and cruel. A Coven Horror is evil and cruelty magnified. A wandering, agonized wretch, the Coven Horror seeks to ruin everything around it, believing that it may free itself from the horrid body it has been bound in.

Vile Origins. The Coven Horror is the result of multiple witches who had made pacts with a demon and failed to live up to their end of the agreement. The witches were fused along with the wailing bodies of children that they had sacrificed in the name of that demon in order to constantly remind them of their failure. Each head of the horror is in control of the main trunk, but they will frequ ently snap at either of the two heads if they feel that the other is too close to their own head.

The horror is left to wander the Abyssal realm, spreading agony and despair throughout. They will take any chance to escape to the prime material plane so that they can to spread terror and dea th, believing that fulfilling their original pact by killing anyone they come across will release them from their torment.

Foe of Demons. The witches that make up this monstrosity will always remember the demon that bound them together. While prone to quickly attacking the firs t thing they see in hopes that it will release their bond, the three witches will occasionally listen and help those who promise to show them to their demonic lord. Coven Horrors are fickle, each of the heads continually coming up with a way to free themselves, the most common choice being to kill those nearest to them in order to gain favor with their demonic binding. Demons fear these abominations, tending to steer clear of them throughout the Abyssal plane.

dreameater.name: Dream Eater
dreameater.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
id-00001.desc: If the dream eater fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The dream eater makes two claw attacks.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (3d8) psychic damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or gain one level of exhaustion.

id-00003.name: Terrorize (Recharge 5-6)
id-00003.desc: The dream eater emits nightmarish visions. Each creature within 10 feet of the dream eater must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or become paralyzed untii the end of the dream eater's next turn.

id-00001.name: Terrorize (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The dream eater can take 2 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dream eater regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Dream Walk
id-00002.desc: The dream eater magically teleports up to 40 feet to an unoccupied space it can see.

id-00003.name: Deep Slumber (Costs 2 Actions)
id-00003.desc: The dream eater targets one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or fall unconscious for 8 hours. The target wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

id-00001.name: Keen Hearing and Smell

id-00002.name: Evasion

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 13 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00001.name: Brave
id-00001.desc: The paladin has advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

id-00002.name: Mounted Combatant

id-00003.name: Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The paladin is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 14). The paladin has the following spells prepared: 1st level (4 slots): ensnaring strike, speak with animals, thunderous smite 2nd level (2 slots): moonbeam, misty step

id-00001.name: Parry

id-00001.name: Multiattack

id-00002.name: Shortsword

id-00003.name: Sling

id-00004.name: Lay on Hands (1/ Day)

p.i: "I can't tell who is more loyal: the Paladin to their casue or the dog to their Paladin" - Camus, Former Caravan Guard

text.p: The Silverpaw guild works to maintain order and justice. Their initiates and veterans are well armed. Their dangerous animal companions trained to undertake any situation. The Silverpaw guild works as the symbol of loyalty and stoicism. Guild paladins show themselves as implacable stewards but rumor has told of wild and dangerous emotions stirring beneath a Silverpaw's stare.

The Legend of the Fey. The founders of the Silverpaw were halflings who, alongside their riding dog companions, stumbled into the Feywild. Suffering the harsh lessons of natural law, the paladins returned, vowing to never'allow the world to transform into the dangerous Feywild. Their dog companions also took fey influences, becoming stronger and larger than normal canines. Every Silverpaw dog's linage can be traced to those original companions and carry the legacy of the fey in their blood.

Initiation. New recruits to the Silverpaw guild are given a dog. While the dogs may vary in size and breed, most are riding dogs or large mastiffs. Expected to raise and protect their animal companion, Silverpaw initiates are then sent to fulfill the requests of the guild. If, at any time, an initiate's dog is Jost during combat the new recruit is expelled.

Eventually, the initiate and their companion will take on a final challenge, being offered a chance to enter the Feywild for three days. If both the initiate and their companion emerge from the experience alive, they are promoted to champions of the Silverpaw guild.

Organization. The Silverpaw guild believes the world is teetering on the brink of chaos. Having seen first hand the influences of the Feywild, Silverpaw champions work to maintain order. Some Silverpaw members return from the Feywild influencea by the chaos of the plane. These members are employed as subtle shock troopers, working to enact Silverpaw desires without drawing attention to the Silverpaw themselves.

id-00005.name: Scour from Existence

id-00002.name: Fist

id-00003.name: Tentacle
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +19 to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d8 + 10) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 20 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00004.name: Maddening Presence
id-00004.desc: Each creature of Ulamog's choice within 120 feet of it and aware of it must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become afflicted with short-term madness (Dungeon Master's Guide pg. 259). If a creature afflicted with short-term madness fails its saving throw, it becomes afflicted with long-term madness. If a creature afflicted with long-term madness fails its saving throw, it becomes afflicted with indefinite madness. If a creature afflicted with indefinite madness fails its saving throw, it dies from psychological trauma. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to Ulamog's Maddening Presence for the next 24 hours.

id-00001.name: Maddening Presence
id-00001.desc: Ulamog can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. Ulamog regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Grip of Desolation
id-00002.desc: Ulamog makes a fist attack. If the attack hits, the target is grappled (escape DC 20) if it is a Huge or smaller creature and Ulamog doesn't have four other creatures grappled. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained and takes 4d10

id-00003.name: psychic damage at the start of each of its turns

id-00004.name: Transgress the Mind (Costs 2 actions)
id-00004.desc: Ulamog casts phantasmal killer, no concentration required. Titan's Presence (Costs 3 actions). Ulamog casts banishment.

A creature that fails the save is afflicted with short-term madness (Dungeon Master's Guide pg. 259). On a successful save, the creature isn't afflicted with madness.

id-00001.name: Tentacle
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

deathwidow.name: Death Widow
deathwidow.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 11

While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated and takes 13 (3d8) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00001.desc: The screecher can't use its blindsight while deafened.

id-00002.name: Keen Hearing
id-00002.desc: The screecher has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 +4) piercing damage.

id-00002.name: Screech (Recharge 5-6)

id-00001.name: Crossbow Expert
id-00001.desc: The trapper ignores the loading quality on crossbows. Additionally, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on its ranged attack rolls.

id-00001.name: Multiattack

id-00002.name: Shortsword

p.i: "His breathing was like a snarling beast. Her eyes flitted like a leaf. I knew these folks to be of the glade, born and raised." -Kima Fathe Emissary of Aalom

text.p: The Gladeborn are a volatile guild, comprised more of sects and individuals rather than a united community. Capable of living exclusively in the wild and often more dangerous than any animal, Gladeborn care little for civilized worlds. Believing in a predator or prey mentality, Gladeborn come across as harsh, cold individuals, prone to leaving for hours simply to get away from their present company.

Circle of Nine. The origin of the Gladeborn, nine druids came together to create a future for their community. Each agreeing that the wilderness honed the perfect person, the Nine require their initiates to grow up in the wild. The Nine view society as a blight upon the land, looking to eventually return the world to the wild.

Scarred Childhood. As children, Gladeborn are taken from cities and villages and placed into the wild. Here, they are forced to grow and survive according the to the desires of their druid mentor. This experience hardens a Gladeborn, making them distrusting and disconnected towards others. Out of place in civilized areas, Gladeborn react with violent outbursts when faced with difficult social situations.

Survival of the Fittest. Gladeborn take on a ritualistic belief of how the world works as they grow in the wild. Gladeborn members work to disrupt civilized communities, using anything in their power to promote a wild existence. Willing to sacrifice the natural world in order to fulfi.11 this desire, Gladeborn are known as cold ' reckless fanatics.

id-00001.desc: The hunter's weapon attacks are magical

id-00002.name: Skilled Tracker
id-00002.desc: The hunter magically knows the distance to and direction of its quarry, so long as the creature is within 50 miles of the hunter.

id-00001.name: Multiattack

id-00004.name: Multishot (Recharge 5-6)

The hunter can make a longbow attack against each creature in that area, dealing an extra 14 (4d6) force damage on a hit. A creature hit by an attack in this way must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the hunter's next turn.

If the target is Medium or smaller and the skull has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches to the target's face, and the target is also blinded while the skull is attached in this way. While attached to the target, the skull can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The skull's speed also becomes 0, and it moves with the target. A creature can detach the skull by making a successful DC 12 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the skull can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

id-00002.desc: If the skull is attached to a creature's face, it inserts its proboscis into the target's mouth. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) poison damage and become poisoned for one hour.

id-00001.desc: Langauges -

id-00002.name: Keen Smell
id-00002.desc: The squirrel has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell.

id-00003.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
id-00003.desc: If the squirrel fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The squirrel makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 19 (2d10 + 8) piercing damage.

id-00003.name: Claw
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d6 + 8) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Tail
id-00004.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +13 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d8 + 8) bludgeoning damage.

id-00005.name: Monstrous Chatter (Recharge 5-6)
id-00005.desc: The squirrel chatters furiously. Each creature within 60 feet of the squirrel and able to hear its chatter must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) thunder damage on a failed save, or half as much damamge on a successful one. If a creature fails the saving throw, it becomes incapacitated until the end of the squirrel's next turn.

id-00001.name: Monstrous Chatter (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The Squirrel can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. The squirrel regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Tail Attack
id-00002.desc: The squirrel makes a tail attack.

id-00003.name: Trample (costs 2 actions)
id-00003.desc: The squirrel moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks. It can move through another creature's space but must end its movement in an unoccupied space. Each creature in the squirrel's path must succeed on a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw or take 15 (2d6 + 8) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone.

id-00004.name: Might of Oaks (costs 3 actions)
id-00004.desc: The squirrel goes into a frenzy, uprooting nearby trees and disrupting the earth around it. Each creature on the grounds within 20 feet of the squirrel must make a DC 21 Dexterity saving throw, taking 24 (7d6) bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The ground in that area becomes difficult terrain.

id-00001.name: Sense darkvision 60 ft
id-00001.desc: , blindsight 60 ft., passive Perception 12

id-00002.name: Hive Mind
id-00002.desc: All slivers within 100 miles of their queen are in constant communication via a telepathic bond.If one sliver is aware of a threat, they all are.

id-00003.name: Amphibious
id-00003.desc: Can breathe in air or water normally.

id-00004.name: Fins of the Hive
id-00004.desc: All slivers within 120 feet of the finned sliver gain the Amphibious trait, blindsight 60 ft., and swim speed 30 ft.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The sliver makes two claw attacks.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damage.

id-00001.name: Camouflage
id-00001.desc: The veralin has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in forest terrain.

id-00002.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00002.desc: The verdalin's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12). The verdalin can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: minor illusion, silent image 1/day each: mirror image, phantasmal force

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 5 (1d4 + 3) piercing damage.

id-00001.name: Keen Sight and Smell
id-00001.desc: The owlbear has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

id-00002.name: Beak
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (1d10 + 5) piercing damage.

id-00003.name: Claw
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Piercing Screech (1/day)
id-00004.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the owlbear that can hear it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become incapacitated for 1 minute. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00001.name: Snow Camouflage
id-00001.desc: The spider has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in snowy terrain.

id-00002.name: Spider Climb
id-00002.desc: The spider can climb difficult surfaces including upside down on ceiling, without needing to make an ability check.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 11 Constitution saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) cold damge on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. If cold damage reduces the target to 0 hit points, the target becomes frozen. A frozen creature is paralyzed, and can thaw by spending 1 hour in warm temperature or taking 15 fire damage.

id-00001.name: Magic Resistance
id-00001.desc: The sprite has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00002.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00002.desc: The sprite's innate spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). It can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components: At will: druidcraft, frostbite 1/day each: blur, counterspell, fog cloud, ice knife, sleet storms, Snilloc's snowball swarm.

id-00001.name: Icesickle
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 slashing damage, and the target must must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or take 3 (1d6) cold damage and then be paralyzed until the end of the sprite's next turn.

wightwalker.name: Wight Walker
wightwalker.damageresistances: cold, necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from non magical weapons that aren't silvered.

id-00001.name: Icesickle
id-00001.desc: Langauges any language it knew in life

id-00002.name: Chilled Body
id-00002.desc: A creature that touches the wight or hits it with a melee attack while within 5 feet of it takes 7 (2d6) cold damage.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The wight makes two battleaxe attacks. It can use its Life Drain in place of one battleaxe attack.

id-00002.name: Battleaxe
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) slashing damamge plus 7 (2d6) cold damage, or 8 (1d10 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) cold damage if used with two hands.

id-00003.name: Life Drain
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) necrotic damamge. The target must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or its hit point maximum is reduced by an amount equal to the damage taken. This reduction lasts until the target finishes a long rest. The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

id-00004.name: Frost Breath (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The wight exhales a blast of frosty wind in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Dexterity Saving throw, taking 27 (6d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

icegolem.name: Ice Golem
icegolem.damageimmunities: cold, poison, psychic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine.
icegolem.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
icegolem.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

id-00001.name: Frozen Aura
id-00001.desc: Intense cold radiates from the golem in an aura with a 20-foot radius. A creature that starts its turn in that area takes 3 (1d6) cold damage. Additionally, the ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.

id-00002.name: Ice Walk
id-00002.desc: The golem ignores difficult terrain caused by ice.

id-00003.name: Icy Death
id-00003.desc: When the golem is reduced to 0 hit points, it shatters in an explosion of jagged ice. Each creature within 10 feet of it must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) piercing damage and 10 (3d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00004.name: Immuntable Form
id-00004.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

id-00005.name: Magic Resistance
id-00005.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells or other magical effects.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

id-00002.name: Slam
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) cold damage.

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
id-00001.desc: If the Jarl fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The jarl makes two greataxe attacks.

id-00002.name: Greataxe
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) cold damage.

id-00003.name: Rock
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: 11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

id-00004.name: Flash Freeze (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The jarl stomps the ground, creating a wave of intense cold in a line that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. If a target fails the saving throw, it becomes restrained by ice. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, breaking free of the ice on the success. The ice can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 15; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to poison and psychic damage).

id-00001.name: Flash Freeze (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The jarl can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. The jarl regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Shove
id-00002.desc: The jarl makes a shove attack.

id-00003.name: Charge
id-00003.desc: The jarl moves up to its speed.

id-00004.name: Battle Order
id-00004.desc: The jarl directs an allied creature to strike, so long as the creature can see or hear the jarl. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack.

id-00001.name: Slippery
id-00001.desc: The rusalka has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

id-00002.name: Universal Beauty
id-00002.desc: The rusalka appears different and uniquely beautiful to match the tastes of each humanoid that perceives it. True sight reveals the rusalka's true undead form.

id-00003.name: Water Bound
id-00003.desc: The rusalka cannot willingly leave the body of water to which it is bound. If forcibly removed, the rusalka takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage every minute until it returns.

id-00001.name: Charm
id-00001.desc: One humanoid the rusalka can see within 100 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 hour. The charmed target must spend its turns trying to move as close to the rusalka as it can. The target can't take reactions, and for its action, it can use only the Dash action. If the target suffers any harm, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect ends, the target is immune to the rusalka's Charm for the next 24 hours. The rusalka can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

id-00002.name: Tresses
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damamge and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) and pulled 5 feet toward the rusalka. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the rusalka tries to drown it, and the rusalka can't use its tresses on another target.

id-00003.name: Tickle
id-00003.desc: One creature grappled by the rusalka must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated with laughter for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

clockworkpest.name: Clockwork Pest
clockworkpest.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
clockworkpest.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

id-00001.name: Potent Injection (1/Day)
id-00001.desc: If the pest hits a creature with its stinger, it can inject a larger dose of poison. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour.

id-00001.name: Stinger
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 5 (2d4) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Leap Attack
id-00001.desc: The froghoul doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage. The froghoul has advantage on this attack if the target is grappled by it.

id-00002.name: Tongue
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 13) and pulled 10 feet toward the froghoul. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00001.name: Spellcasting
id-00001.desc: The enchanter is a 9th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The enchanter knows the following sorcerer spells: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): charm person, mage armor, shield 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, suggestion 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, dispel magic 4th level (3 slots): confusion, dominate beast 5th level (1 slots): dominate person

id-00001.name: Invoke Doubt
id-00001.desc: If the enchanter is the target of an attack and can see the attacker, it imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

id-00001.name: Mind Lash
id-00001.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) psychic damage and the creature has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws until the end of the enchanter's next turn.

id-00001.name: Enthralling Aura
id-00001.desc: Attack rolls against the mind sculptor have disadvantage.

id-00002.name: Spellcasting
id-00002.desc: The mind sculptor is a 13th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The mind sculptor knows the following sorcerer spells: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, mage, message, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): charm person, mage armor, shield 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, suggestion 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, dispel magic 4th level (3 slots): confusion, dominate beast 5th level (2 slots): dominate person, seeming 6th level (1 slots): mass suggestion 7th level (1 slots): prismatic spray

id-00001.name: Melt Mind
id-00001.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d10) psychic damage and the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become stunned until the end of the mind sculptor's next turn.

id-00002.name: Pacify
id-00002.desc: The mind sculptor targets one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature can't attack or otherwise harm another creature. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The mind sculptor can have only one target charmed at a time in this way. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

id-00001.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
id-00001.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold commander has disadvantage on attack rolles, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00001.name: Longsword
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

id-00002.name: Longbow
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

infestationswarm.name: Infestation Swarm
infestationswarm.conditionimmunities: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

id-00001.name: Swarm
id-00001.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

id-00001.name: Bites
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Oft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 21 (6d6) piercing damage, or 10 (3d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

id-00002.name: Infest (Recharge 6)
id-00002.desc: One creature in the swarm's space must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become infested by the swarm; the swarm then disappears inside the host, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The swarm now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The swarm can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. It otherwise uses the infested target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The infestation lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the swarm ends it as a bonus action, or the swarm is forced out by an effect that removes disease like the lesser restoration spell. When the infestation ends, the swarm reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this swarm's Infest for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the infestation ends.

livingspellbook.name: Living Spellbook
livingspellbook.damageimmunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
livingspellbook.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

id-00001.name: Immutable Form
id-00001.desc: The spellbook is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

id-00002.name: Magic Resistance
id-00002.desc: The spellbook has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The spellbook is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The spellbook has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, mirror image 3rd level (3 slots): glyph of warding, dispel magic 4th level (3 slots): Otiluke's resilient sphere, polymorph 5th level (2 slots): animate objects, Bigby's hand 6th level (1 slots): globe of invulnerability

id-00004.name: Transpose Arcana
id-00004.desc: As a bonus action, the spell book can expend one spell slot, causing an allied spellcaster to regain a spell slot of that level or lower.

id-00001.name: Paper Cut
id-00001.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) slashing damage.

id-00002.name: Mana Burn (Recharge 5-6)
id-00002.desc: The spellbook can expend one spell slot to deal force damage to a target within 60 feet of it. The damage is 18 (4d8) for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 9 (2d8) for each spell level higher than 1st. The target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking full damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

wartitan.name: War Titan
wartitan.damageresistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical weapons

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
id-00001.desc: If the titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00002.name: Magic Resistance
id-00002.desc: The titan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00003.name: Magic Weapons
id-00003.desc: The titan's weapon attacks are magical.

id-00004.name: Well-Armed
id-00004.desc: The titan can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

id-00001.name: Parry
id-00001.desc: The titan gains +5 AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the titan must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The titan makes two melee weapon attacks.

id-00002.name: Longsword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) slashing damage.

id-00003.name: Blade Storm (Recharge 5-6)
id-00003.desc: The titan swings its weapons in a whirlwind of steel. Each creature within 10 feet of the titan must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage, and 18 (4d8) piercing damage, and 18 (4d8) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

id-00001.name: Parry
id-00001.desc: The titan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The titan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Attack
id-00002.desc: The titan makes one attack.

id-00003.name: War Cry (costs 2 actions)
id-00003.desc: Each creature within 120 feet of the titan that can hear it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (4d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

id-00004.name: Hold the Line (Costs 2 actions)
id-00004.desc: The titan gains 26 (4d12) temporary hit points.

id-00001.name: Water Susceptibility
id-00001.desc: For ever 5 feet the bear moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damge.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The bear makes two attacks: One with its bite and one with its claws.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

id-00003.name: Claws
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The bear exhales a blast of flames in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Acidic Blood
id-00001.desc: A creature that hits the crawler with a melee attack while within 5 ft of it takes 7 (2d6) acid damage.

id-00002.name: Caustic Fumes
id-00002.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the crawler must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the crawler's fumes for 24 hours.

id-00001.name: Claws
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

id-00002.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
id-00002.desc: The crawler spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

evildoll.name: Evil Doll
evildoll.damageresistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
evildoll.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

id-00001.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
id-00001.desc: Devil's Sight. Magical darkness doesn't impede the doll's darkvision.

id-00002.name: Inanimate
id-00002.desc: While the doll remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary doll.

id-00003.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The doll's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The doll can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: suggestion 1/day each: dominate person, modify memory

id-00004.name: Undying Evil
id-00004.desc: If the doll is destroyed, it regains all its hitpoints and reappears at a nearby location in 24 hours unless a remove curse spell is cast on its remains.

id-00001.name: Giggle
id-00001.desc: One creature of the doll's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage and become frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the doll is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00001.name: Amphibious
id-00001.desc: The gill-man can breathe air and water.

id-00002.name: Regeneration
id-00002.desc: The gill-man regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the gill-man is poisoned, this trait doesn't function. If the gill-man takes poison damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the gill-man's next turn. The gi ll-man dies only if it starts its turn with O hit points and doesn 't regenerate. Swimby. The gill-man doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it swims out of an enemy's reach.

id-00003.name: Torpedo Attack
id-00003.desc: If the gill-man swims at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 9 (2d8) damage to the target.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The gill-man makes two attacks with its claws.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

id-00001.name: Aggressive
id-00001.desc: As a bonus action, the killer can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

id-00002.name: Ambusher
id-00002.desc: The killer has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

id-00003.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
id-00003.desc: If the killer takes 20 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

id-00004.name: Surprise Attack
id-00004.desc: If the killer surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) damage from the attack.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The killer makes three melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Shortsword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 ( 1d6+4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or lose 5 (1d10) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. Each time the killer hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (1d10). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

headlesshorseman.name: Headless Horseman
headlesshorseman.languages: understands Common, Abyssal, and Infernal but can't speak

id-00001.name: Mounted Combatant
id-00001.desc: The horseman can force an attack targeted at its mount to target itself instead.

id-00002.name: Ride-By
id-00002.desc: While mounted, the horseman and its mount don't provoke opportunity attacks when they move out of an enemy's reach.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The horseman makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Vorpal Longsword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack:+ 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) slashing damage. When the horseman rolls a 20 on the attack roll, if the damage would reduce the creature to 0 hit points, the horseman cuts off the creature's head. Jack-o'-lantern (Recharge 6). Ranged Weapon Attack:+ 7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of the horseman's next turn.

text.p: A headless horseman always hunts for heads while riding its mount. Some may be found riding a living or skeletal warhorse. Particularly powerful horsemen ride dread steeds, hellish mounts that invoke as much fear as their riders. A dread steed uses the statistics of a nightmare, except that it has no fly speed.

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
id-00001.desc: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The king makes two slam attacks.

id-00002.name: Slam
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Squash
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack:+ 11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00004.name: Gourd
id-00004.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

id-00005.name: Seed Spit (Recharge 5-6)
id-00005.desc: The king spits pumpkin seeds in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 (1 Od8) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Seed Spit (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The king can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The king regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Squash
id-00002.desc: The king makes a squash attack.

id-00003.name: Vine Lash (Costs 2 Actions)
id-00003.desc: The king lashes out with entangling vines. Each enemy creature within 20 feet of the king must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained. A creature restrained by the vines can use its action to make a DC 19 Strength check, freeing itself on a success. The vines can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12; hp 20; vulnerability to slashing damage).

id-00004.name: Trick or Treat (Costs 3 Actions)
id-00004.desc: The king scatters up to three pumpkins, which fall in unoccupied spaces within 20 feet of the king. Each pumpkin then polymorphs into any kind of creature whose challenge rating is 4 or less, and acts as an ally of its king. The creatures revert to ordinary pumpkins when destroyed. The king can't control more than three polymorphed pumpkins at a time.

id-00001.desc: If the ape is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage to the target.

id-00002.name: Monkey Grip
id-00002.desc: The ape can wield a two-handed weapon in one hand.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The ape makes two attacks: one with its fist and one with its greatsword.

id-00002.name: Fist
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Greatsword
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Rock
id-00004.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 25/50 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

id-00001.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00001.desc: The feyote's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. The feyote can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At will: druidcraft 1/day: enhance ability 1/week: divination

id-00002.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
id-00002.desc: The feyote has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

id-00003.name: Magic Resistance
id-00003.desc: The feyote has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00001.desc: The scorpikis has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving th rows made against effects that would knock it prone.

id-00001.name: Parry
id-00001.desc: The scorpikis adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the scorpikis must see the attacker.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The scorpikis makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its sting. It can make a glaive attack in place of a claw attack.

id-00002.name: Claw

id-00003.name: Glaive
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Sting

The chronomancer has the following wizard sells prepared: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, mage hand, ray of frost, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, expeditious retreat, magic missile, shield 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, misty step 3rd level (3 slots): blink, haste, slow 4th level (3 slots): banishment, dimension door 5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

id-00001.desc: If the chronomancer is targeted by a ranged attack, it can alter the flow of time nearby, causing incoming projectiles to slow down. Until the start of its next turn, the chronomancer has a +10 bonus to AC against ranged attacks.

id-00001.name: Unmake
id-00001.desc: The chronomancer choses one creature it can see within 60 feet of it, causing the target's flesh to rapidly age and decompose. The target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) necrotic damage on a fai led save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

text.p: The chronomancer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The chronomancer has the following wizard sells prepared:

text.p: The chronomancer is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The chronomancer has the following wizard sells prepared:

Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

id-00001.name: Ethereal Sight
id-00001.desc: The geist can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material plane, and vice versa.

id-00002.name: Incorporeal Movement
id-00002.desc: The geist can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

id-00001.name: Multiattack

Until this grapple ends, the target is restra ined and takes 3 (1d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.

id-00003.desc: The geist enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

id-00001.name: Amphibious

id-00002.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
id-00002.desc: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting (Bullywug Form Only)
id-00003.desc: The bullywug is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The bullywug has the following druid spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, shape water, shillelagh 1st level (4 slots): fog cloud, create or destroy water, cure wounds 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, misty step 3rd level (2 slots): tidal wave, wall of water

id-00004.name: Swamp Camouflage
id-00004.desc: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

id-00005.name: Standing Leap
id-00005.desc: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

id-00001.name: Mace
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage.

id-00002.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
id-00002.desc: The bullywug magically polymorphs into a giant toad, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics are replaced by the statistics of a giant toad, but it retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. Any equipment it is wearing merges into the new form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

id-00001.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
id-00001.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold has disadvantage on attack rolls, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The kobold is a 4th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The kobold has the following spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, produceflame, shillelagh 1st level (4 slots): cure wounds,fog cloud, healing word 2nd level (3 slots):flaming sphere, heat metal

id-00001.name: Club
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +1 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d4 -1) bludgeoning damage.

text.p: Scents of heavy herbs, the clattering of trinkets and the subtle whispering of a cunning mind mark the arrival of a Kobold Shaman. Imbued with the magic of their god Tiamat, Kobold Shamans rule their tribe of kobolds, using guile and deception to keep their place. Kobold Shamans are frail but agile, their lives pushing them more to avoiding combat than getting into it themselves.

Rite of the Elements. Kobold Shamans must display their connection to the dragon god Tiamat. Those chosen to become a shaman must undergo a ritual of elements, being subjected to searing heat, deathly cold and noxious acid. Those who emerge from the ritual alive are awakened to the arcane energies of Tiamat.

Power of the Tribe. Wielding Tiamat's magic, Kobold Shamans are the heart and mind of their tribe. Sitting on the top of the social hierarchy, Shamans delegate tasks in the tribe. Yet, their power is always tentative, as other kobolds grow agitated and envious. Kobold Shamans are quick to notice unrest in the tribe and are not above resorting to assassination or banishment to ensure their power remains intact.

id-00001.name: Magic Scent
id-00001.desc: The arcanamite can pinpoint, by scent, the location of a creature that can cast spells within 60 feet of it.

id-00002.name: Reflective Carapace
id-00002.desc: Any time the arcanamite is targeted by a magic missile spell, a line spell, or a spell that requires a ranged attack roll, roll a d6. On a 1 to 5, the arcanamite is unaffected. On a 6, the arcanamite is unaffected, and the effect is reflected back at the caster as though it originated from the arcanamite, turning the caster into the target.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit:4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage, and the arcanamite can attach itself to the target. The arcanamite can be removed if a creature takes an action and succeeds on a DC 15 Strength check against it.The arcanamite detaches if it takes fire damage. Until the arcanamite detaches, it can't bite another target.

id-00002.name: Leech Magic
id-00002.desc: If the arcanamite is attached to a creature with spell slots, roll a d4. The target loses a spell slot of that level, or the next highest level if it has no spell slots of that level. If the arcanamite has leeched a number of spell slots with a combined level of 8 or more, it detaches from the creature.

text.p: Beautiful to look at, horrific to come across, Arcanamites scuttle through the deep places of the world, creating massive hive networks that stretch for miles. Drawn to magical energy, they nest closely to areas rich in arcane power, draining the region dry. Magic bounces harmlessly from Arcanamites as they swarm around their targets, burrowing into them with razor-sharp pincers and needle beaks.

Prized Possession. Partially made of arcane-infused gem, an Arcanamite's carapace is valuable to spellcasters and rare jewel crafters. Expeditions to Arcanamite hives, while dangerous, can provide a fortuitous haul. Spellcasters will sometimes attempt to capture an Arcanamite alive, using it as a defender or to harry other arcane-users.

Swarm Fighters. Arcanamites sense arcane energy, moving to the most potent source first. They use needle-like barbs to latch onto their target, draining arcane energy. Arcanamites are rarely alone, living and fighting in large swarms. Once they sense magic energy, Arcanamites rush toward their target, ignoring the attacks and magic that bounce off of their resistant shell.

Dangerous Friends. Arcanamites that are kept by lords and spellcasters are not trustworthy pets. Unless an adequate amount of arcane energy is given, Arcanamites will attempt to kill their captors, draining them of their magic or return to their hive.

Addictive Qualities. The sensation left by Arcanamite draining is both painful but highly stimulating. Occasionally, spellcasters who experience this effect grow dependent of it. Aracanamites will remain latched on a target for years, draining arcane energy from their host while the victim is lost in the experience.

id-00001.name: Hive Mind
id-00001.desc: All slivers within 100 miles of their queen are in constant communication via a telepathic bond.If one sliver is aware of a threat, they all are.

id-00002.name: Armor of the Hive

id-00001.name: Immutable Form
id-00001.desc: The golem is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

id-00002.name: Magic Resistance
id-00002.desc: The golem has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00003.desc: The golem's weapon attacks are magical.

id-00002.name: Slam
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Bone Prison
id-00003.desc: The golem targets one creature it can see within 60 feet of it. A prison of magical bones surrounds the creature. The target must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained. The restrained creature can break free by succeeding on a DC 20 escape check, or by destroying the bone prison (AC 20; 50 hit points; immunity to poison and psychic damage). The golem can only have one bone prison active at a time. It may dismiss the bone prison as a bonus action.

text.p: "At first we scoffed as the bones rattled, then when the entire pile rose, we fled - the screams of the overconfident filling the air behind us." - Kendrick Hiln thief of the Black Nine

A Bone Golem is the defiled abomination of animated skeletons crafted into a singular entity that desires nothing more than to add more material to its hideous form. Similar to other golems, Bone Golems serve the commands of their masters, following them with disturbing ferocity and precision. Sharing traits with its lesser skeletal counterparts, Bone Golems do not try to damage themselves to reach a goal, instead resorting to try a door handle rather than harm themselves by breaking through it.

Necromancers who have created these monstrosities also have the presence of mind to make the Bone Golem itself a master of bone. Capable of gathering bones together into a prison for its victims, Bone Golems serve adeptly as guards of ancient tombs or its master's personal studies.

An empty shell driven by negative energy, the many heads of the Bone Golem still quietly whisper with the pain and suffering of those used to create the construct. Faint screams and cry echo from Bone Golems.

id-00003.name: Self Destruct
id-00003.desc: When the dragon is reduced to O hit points, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 21 (6d6) fire damage and 21 (6d6) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The dragon makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) piercing damage.

id-00003.name: Claw
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d6 + 6) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Tail
id-00004.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

id-00005.name: Breath Weapons (Recharge 5-6)
id-00005.desc: The dragon uses one of the following breath weapons.

id-00006.name: Fire Tar Breath
id-00006.desc: The dragon sprays flaming tar in a 30-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 (1 Od6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. On a failed save, a creature is restrained (escape DC 18). While restrained in this way, a creature takes 1 O (3d6) fire damage at the start of each of its turns.

id-00007.name: Knockout Gas Breath
id-00007.desc: The dragon exhales knockout gas in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or fall unconscious for 1 O minutes. This effect ends for a creature if the creature takes damage or someone uses an action to wake it.

id-00001.name: Knockout Gas Breath
id-00001.desc: The dragon can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The dragon regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Detect
id-00002.desc: The dragon makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

id-00003.name: Tail Attack
id-00003.desc: The dragon makes a tail attack.

id-00004.name: Wing Attack (Costs 2 Actions)
id-00004.desc: The dragon beats its wings. Each creature within 10 feet of the dragon must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or take 13 (2d6 + 6) bludgeoning damage and be knocked prone. The dragon can then fly up to half its flying speed.

id-00001.name: Hive Mind
id-00001.desc: All slivers within 100 miles of their queen are in constant communication via a telepathic bond.If one sliver is aware of a threat, they all are.

id-00002.name: Resistance of the Hive
id-00002.desc: All slivers within 120 feet of the crystalline sliver have the Crystalline Skin feature.

id-00003.name: Crystalline Skin
id-00003.desc: The sliver has resistance to damage from spells and advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The sliver makes two daw attacks.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8 + 4) slashing damage.

id-00001.name: Hive Mind
id-00001.desc: All slivers within 100 miles of their queen are in constant communication via a telepathic bond. If one sliver is aware of a threat, they all are.

id-00002.name: Acidity of the Hive
id-00002.desc: All slivers within 120 feet of the spitting sliver can use the Acid Spray action.

id-00001.name: Muftiattack
id-00001.desc: The s iver makes two claw attacks.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (Td8 + 3) slashing damage.

id-00003.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
id-00003.desc: The sliver spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

fallenangel.name: Fallen Angel
fallenangel.damageresistances: necrotic, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons

id-00001.name: Corrupted Weapons
id-00001.desc: The angel's weapon attacks are magical. When the angel hits with any weapon, the weapon deals an extra 4d8 necrotic damage (included in the attack).

id-00002.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00002.desc: The angel's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 16). The angel can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: detect evil and good, 1/day each: death ward, harm,

id-00003.name: Magic Resistance
id-00003.desc: The angel has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00004.name: Shapechanger
id-00004.desc: The angel can use its action to polymorph into a Small or Medium humanoid, or back into its true form. Its statistics, other than its size, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The angel makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Scimitar
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 (1d6 + 4) slashing damage plus 18 (4d8) necrotic damage.

id-00003.name: Vampiric Touch (3/day)
id-00003.desc: Melee Spell Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (4d8) necrotic damage, and the angel regains hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

id-00001.name: False Appearance
id-00001.desc: While the lizard remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from a normal plant, such as a colorful fern.

id-00001.name: Tail
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d4 + 2) piercing damage.

id-00002.name: Venemous Spittle (Recharge 5-6)
id-00002.desc: The lizard spits a glob of venom at a creature it can see within 15 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw or be blinded until the end of the lizard's next turn.

text.p: Fern Lizards are quick land omnivores with the body of a lizard and the upper torso comprised of two small talons, a small fanged mouth and beady eyes. The entirety of a Fern Lizard's body appears as though it is made of a foliage. Capable of easily blending into its surroundings, Fern Lizards wait patiently for prey to come to them.

Patient Hunter. Capable of standing immobile for hours, Fern Lizards wait for meals to stumble before them rather than waste energy hunting them down. Insects and plant life inspire them to voracious appetites. Fern Lizards are often seen slowly burrowing into tree trunks, using their acidic spittle to bore small holes to devour insects.

Prized Pet. Whether caught young or raised from an egg, a Fern Lizard can be trained to serve as a companion. Considered good luck and useful spies for druids, Fern Lizards are often in their company. Nobility view these creatures as exotic additions to their home, investing large sums of money to acquire them.

Once trained, a Fern Lizard is a loyal and useful companion. It bonds with one master for life and serves that master to the best of its abilities. A Fern Lizard requires satiation of its omnivorous appetite. Prone to capture or kidnapping, masters must be careful when bringing Fern Lizards in public as they immediately draw attention to both themselves and their owners.

Small Stewards. Fern Lizards make their nests in heavy growths of foliage, well away from the eyes of predators. Establishing their territory as a colony, Fern Lizards work as guardians of their surrounding area. Removing the region of pestilence and danger, these lizards become allies of druids and lovers of nature.

Fern Lizards have been known to help those who support and care for their environment, acting as guides for lost travelers and providing sources of food to those in need. Alternatively, Fern Lizards are extremely aggressive and territorial to those who bring trouble to their environment. Fern Lizards harry travelers; steal food and lead wanderers astray until the traveler flees or dies.

fusionelemental.name: Fusion Elemental
fusionelemental.damageimmunities: acid, cold, fire, lightning, poison, bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
fusionelemental.conditionimmunities: exhaustion, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, restrained, unconscious

id-00001.name: Volatile Form
id-00001.desc: When the elemental dies, it explodes, and each creature within 30 feet of it must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 10 (3d6) acid damage, 10 (3d6) lightning damage, 10 (3d6) fire damage, and 10 (3d6) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Multlattack
id-00001.desc: The elemental makes two slam attacks.

id-00002.name: Slam
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, reach 1 Oft., one target. Hit: 20 (2d10 + 9) bludgeoning damage plus 9 (2d8) damage of a type chosen randomly from the following: acid, lightning, fire, or cold.

id-00003.name: Hurl Energy
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +14 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d8 + 9) damage of a type chosen randomly from the following: acid, lightning, fire, or cold. Elemental Chaos (Recharge 5-6). The elemental makes one elemental chaos attack at random.

id-00004.desc: Earthquake. A seismic disturbance radiates from the elemental in a 100-foot radius circle. Each creature on the ground in that area must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be knocked prone. Each creature on the ground that is concentrating must also succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or break concentration. The area becomes difficult terrain after the earthquake.

id-00005.desc: Fire Breath. The elemental exhales fire in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw, taking 54 ( 12d8) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00006.desc: Tidal Wave. A massive wave emanates from the elemental. Each creature within 60 feet of the elemental must succeed on a DC 18 Strength saving throw or be pushed up to 60 feet away from the elemental. On a success, the creature is pushed 10 feet away from the elemental.

id-00007.desc: Whirlwind. The elemental summons a 10-foot-radius, 60-foot high whirlwind centered on a point within 120 feet of it. Each creature in that area must make a DC 18 Strength saving throw. On a failure, a target takes 27 (6d8) bludgeoning damage and is flung up to 40 feet away in a random direction and knocked prone. If a thrown target strikes an object, such as a wall or floor, the target takes 3 (1d6) bludgeoning damage for every 10 feet it was thrown. If the target is thrown at another creature, that creature must succeed on a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or take the same damage and be knocked prone. If the saving throw is successful, the target takes half the bludgeoning damage and isn't flung away or knocked prone.

id-00001.desc: The elemental can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The elemental regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Hurl Energy
id-00002.desc: The elemental uses its Hurl Energy.

id-00003.name: Harness Energy (Costs 2 actions)
id-00003.desc: The elemental regains use of its Elemental Chaos.

id-00004.name: Unstable Outburst (Costs 3 actions)
id-00004.desc: The elemental loses control of its chaotic energies. Each creature within 30 feet of the elemental, including the elemental itself, must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 21 (6d6) damage of a type chosen randomly from the following: acid, lightning, fire, or cold. A creature takes half damage on a success. The elemental has no immunity to the damage caused by this outburst.

id-00001.name: Sprinter
id-00001.desc: The gazellean can take the Dash or Disengage action as a bonus action on each of its turns.

id-00002.name: Alert
id-00002.desc: The gazellean has advantage on Dexterity checks for initiative. Additionally, the gazellean can't be surprised, and other creatures don't gain advantage on attack rolls against it as a result of being hidden from it.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The gazellean makes two melee attacks or two ranged attacks.

id-00002.name: Javelin
id-00002.desc: Melee or Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., or range 30/120 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) piercing damage.

id-00001.name: Rampage
id-00001.desc: When the gnoll reduces a creature to 0 hit points with a melee attack on its turn, the gnoll can take a bonus action to move up to half its speed and make a bite attack.

id-00002.name: Aura of Malice
id-00002.desc: All enemies within 10 feet of the gnoll have disadvantage on saving throws.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The gnoll makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its greatsword.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one creature. Hit:1 (1d6 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or take 14 (4d6) necrotic damage.

id-00003.name: Greatsword
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d6 + 4) slashing damage.

text.p: Yeenoghu chose gnoll Death Knights for his strength. Unlike fang's that can turn hyenas into gnolls, Death Knights are imbued with Yeenoghu's raw power.
