id-00003.name: Maddening Roar (Recharge 6)
id-00003.desc: The sire emits a mind-shattering roar. Each creature of the sire's choice within 100 feet of it and able to hear the roar must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 44 (8d10) psychic damage, or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature that fails the save is afflicted with short-term madness (Dungeon Master's Guide pg. 259). On a successful save, the creature isn't afflicted with madness.

id-00001.name: Stench
id-00001.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the tentaghoul must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the tentaghoul's Stench for 24 hours.

id-00002.name: Turning Defiance
id-00002.desc: The tentaghoul and any ghouls within 30 feet of it have advantage on saving throws against effects that turn undead.

id-00001.name: Tentacle
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

deathwidow.name: Death Widow
deathwidow.senses: blindsight 10 ft., darkvision 60 ft., passive Perception 11

id-00001.name: Spider Climb
id-00001.desc: The Widow can climb difficult surfaces including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

id-00002.name: Web Sense
id-00002.desc: While in contact with a web, the widow knows the exact location of any other creature in contact with the same web.

id-00003.name: Web Walker
id-00003.desc: The Widow ignores movement restrictions caused by webbing.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d10 + 3) piercing damage, and the target must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned. While poisoned in this way, the target is incapacitated and takes 13 (3d8) poison damage at the start of each of its turns. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00001.name: Echolocation
id-00001.desc: The screecher can't use its blindsight while deafened.

id-00002.name: Keen Hearing
id-00002.desc: The screecher has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 +4) piercing damage.

id-00002.name: Screech (Recharge 5-6)
id-00002.desc: Each creature within 60 feet of the screecher that can hear it must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of the screecher's next turn.

id-00001.name: Crossbow Expert
id-00001.desc: The trapper ignores the loading quality on crossbows. Additionally, being within 5 feet of a hostile creature doesn't impose disadvantage on its ranged attack rolls.

id-00001.name: Multiattack

id-00002.name: Shortsword

id-00004.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d3 + 3) bludgeoning damage and the target is restrained for 1 minute (escape DC 13)

p.i: "His breathing was like a snarling beast. Her eyes flitted like a leaf. I knew these folks to be of the glade, born and raised." -Kima Fathe Emissary of Aalom

text.p: The Gladeborn are a volatile guild, comprised more of sects and individuals rather than a united community. Capable of living exclusively in the wild and often more dangerous than any animal, Gladeborn care little for civilized worlds. Believing in a predator or prey mentality, Gladeborn come across as harsh, cold individuals, prone to leaving for hours simply to get away from their present company.

Circle of Nine. The origin of the Gladeborn, nine druids came together to create a future for their community. Each agreeing that the wilderness honed the perfect person, the Nine require their initiates to grow up in the wild. The Nine view society as a blight upon the land, looking to eventually return the world to the wild.

Scarred Childhood. As children, Gladeborn are taken from cities and villages and placed into the wild. Here, they are forced to grow and survive according the to the desires of their druid mentor. This experience hardens a Gladeborn, making them distrusting and disconnected towards others. Out of place in civilized areas, Gladeborn react with violent outbursts when faced with difficult social situations.

Survival of the Fittest. Gladeborn take on a ritualistic belief of how the world works as they grow in the wild. Gladeborn members work to disrupt civilized communities, using anything in their power to promote a wild existence. Willing to sacrifice the natural world in order to fulfi.11 this desire, Gladeborn are known as cold ' reckless fanatics.

id-00001.desc: The hunter's weapon attacks are magical

id-00002.name: Skilled Tracker
id-00002.desc: The hunter magically knows the distance to and direction of its quarry, so long as the creature is within 50 miles of the hunter.

The hunter can make a longbow attack against each creature in that area, dealing an extra 14 (4d6) force damage on a hit. A creature hit by an attack in this way must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be stunned until the end of the hunter's next turn.

If the target is Medium or smaller and the skull has advantage on the attack roll, it attaches to the target's face, and the target is also blinded while the skull is attached in this way. While attached to the target, the skull can attack no other creature except the target but has advantage on its attack rolls. The skull's speed also becomes 0, and it moves with the target. A creature can detach the skull by making a successful DC 12 Strength check as an action. On its turn, the skull can detach itself from the target by using 5 feet of movement.

id-00002.name: Kiss of Undeath (1/Day)
id-00002.desc: If the skull is attached to a creature's face, it inserts its proboscis into the target's mouth. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 10 (3d6) poison damage and become poisoned for one hour.

The target dies if this effect reduces its hit point maximum to 0. A humanoid slain by this attack rises 24 hours later as a zombie under the wight's control, unless the humanoid is restored to life or its body destroyed. The wight can have no more than twelve zombies under its control at one time.

id-00001.desc: The golem makes two slam attacks.

id-00002.name: Slam
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (3d8 + 5) bludgeoning damage plus 4 (1d8) cold damage.

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
id-00001.desc: If the Jarl fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The jarl makes two greataxe attacks.

id-00002.name: Greataxe
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 26 (3d12 + 7) slashing damage plus 4 (1d8) cold damage.

id-00003.name: Rock
id-00003.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: 11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 29 (4d10 + 7) bludgeoning damage.

id-00004.name: Flash Freeze (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The jarl stomps the ground, creating a wave of intense cold in a line that is 60 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 (10d8) cold damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save. If a target fails the saving throw, it becomes restrained by ice. As an action, the restrained target can make a DC 15 Strength check, breaking free of the ice on the success. The ice can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 10; hp 15; vulnerability to fire damage; immunity to poison and psychic damage).

id-00001.name: Flash Freeze (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The jarl can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action can be used at a time, and only at the end of another creature's turn. The jarl regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Shove
id-00002.desc: The jarl makes a shove attack.

id-00003.name: Charge
id-00003.desc: The jarl moves up to its speed.

id-00004.name: Battle Order
id-00004.desc: The jarl directs an allied creature to strike, so long as the creature can see or hear the jarl. That creature can immediately use its reaction to make one weapon attack.

id-00001.name: Slippery
id-00001.desc: The rusalka has advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to escape a grapple.

id-00002.name: Universal Beauty
id-00002.desc: The rusalka appears different and uniquely beautiful to match the tastes of each humanoid that perceives it. True sight reveals the rusalka's true undead form.

id-00003.name: Water Bound
id-00003.desc: The rusalka cannot willingly leave the body of water to which it is bound. If forcibly removed, the rusalka takes 11 (2d10) necrotic damage every minute until it returns.

id-00001.name: Charm
id-00001.desc: One humanoid the rusalka can see within 100 feet of it must succeed on a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed for 1 hour. The charmed target must spend its turns trying to move as close to the rusalka as it can. The target can't take reactions, and for its action, it can use only the Dash action. If the target suffers any harm, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. If the target successfully saves against the effect, or if the effect ends, the target is immune to the rusalka's Charm for the next 24 hours. The rusalka can have only one target charmed at a time. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

id-00002.name: Tresses
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (3d6 + 4) bludgeoning damamge and the target is grappled (escape DC 16) and pulled 5 feet toward the rusalka. Until this grapple ends, the target is restrained, the rusalka tries to drown it, and the rusalka can't use its tresses on another target.

id-00003.name: Tickle
id-00003.desc: One creature grappled by the rusalka must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be incapacitated with laughter for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

clockworkpest.name: Clockwork Pest
clockworkpest.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned
clockworkpest.languages: understands the languages of its creator but can't speak

id-00001.name: Potent Injection (1/Day)
id-00001.desc: If the pest hits a creature with its stinger, it can inject a larger dose of poison. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 hour.

id-00001.name: Stinger
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1 piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 10 Constitution saving throw, taking 5 (2d4) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Leap Attack
id-00001.desc: The froghoul doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it moves out of an enemy's reach.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) piercing damage. The froghoul has advantage on this attack if the target is grappled by it.

id-00002.name: Tongue
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 15 ft., one creature. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) bludgeoning damage and the target is grappled (escape DC 13) and pulled 10 feet toward the froghoul. If the target is a creature other than an undead, it must succeed on a DC 10 Constitution saving throw or be paralyzed for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00001.name: Spellcasting
id-00001.desc: The enchanter is a 9th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The enchanter knows the following sorcerer spells: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): charm person, mage armor, shield 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, suggestion 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, dispel magic 4th level (3 slots): confusion, dominate beast 5th level (1 slots): dominate person

id-00001.name: Invoke Doubt
id-00001.desc: If the enchanter is the target of an attack and can see the attacker, it imposes disadvantage on the attack roll.

id-00001.name: Mind Lash
id-00001.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +6 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 11 (2d10) psychic damage and the creature has disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws until the end of the enchanter's next turn.

id-00001.name: Enthralling Aura
id-00001.desc: Attack rolls against the mind sculptor have disadvantage.

id-00002.name: Spellcasting
id-00002.desc: The mind sculptor is a 13th level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Charisma (save DC 17, +9 to hit with spell attacks). The mind sculptor knows the following sorcerer spells: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, mage, message, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): charm person, mage armor, shield 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, suggestion 3rd level (3 slots): counterspell, dispel magic 4th level (3 slots): confusion, dominate beast 5th level (2 slots): dominate person, seeming 6th level (1 slots): mass suggestion 7th level (1 slots): prismatic spray

id-00001.name: Melt Mind
id-00001.desc: Ranged Spell Attack: +9 to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (3d10) psychic damage and the creature must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or become stunned until the end of the mind sculptor's next turn.

id-00002.name: Pacify
id-00002.desc: The mind sculptor targets one creature that it can see within 60 feet of it. The target must succeed on a DC 17 Wisdom saving throw or be magically charmed. The charmed creature can't attack or otherwise harm another creature. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success. The mind sculptor can have only one target charmed at a time in this way. If it charms another, the effect on the previous target ends.

id-00001.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
id-00001.desc: While in sunlight, the kobold commander has disadvantage on attack rolles, as well as on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight.

id-00002.name: Pack Tactics
id-00002.desc: The kobold has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the kobold's allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn't incapacitated.

id-00001.name: Longsword
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) slashing damage.

id-00002.name: Longbow
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d8 + 1) piercing damage.

infestationswarm.name: Infestation Swarm
infestationswarm.conditionimmunities: charmed, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, prone, restrained, stunned

id-00001.name: Swarm
id-00001.desc: The swarm can occupy another creature's space and vice versa, and the swarm can move through any opening large enough for a tiny insect. The swarm can't regain hit points or gain temporary hit points.

id-00001.name: Bites
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +6 to hit, reach Oft., one creature in the swarm's space. Hit: 21 (6d6) piercing damage, or 10 (3d6) piercing damage if the swarm has half of its hit points or fewer.

id-00002.name: Infest (Recharge 6)
id-00002.desc: One creature in the swarm's space must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or become infested by the swarm; the swarm then disappears inside the host, and the target is incapacitated and loses control of its body. The swarm now controls the body but doesn't deprive the target of awareness. The swarm can't be targeted by any attack, spell, or other effect, and it retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma. It otherwise uses the infested target's statistics, but doesn't gain access to the target's knowledge, class features, or proficiencies. The infestation lasts until the body drops to 0 hit points, the swarm ends it as a bonus action, or the swarm is forced out by an effect that removes disease like the lesser restoration spell. When the infestation ends, the swarm reappears in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the body. The target is immune to this swarm's Infest for 24 hours after succeeding on the saving throw or after the infestation ends.

livingspellbook.name: Living Spellbook
livingspellbook.damageimmunities: poison; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't adamantine
livingspellbook.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

id-00001.name: Immutable Form
id-00001.desc: The spellbook is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

id-00002.name: Magic Resistance
id-00002.desc: The spellbook has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The spellbook is a 12th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 16, +8 to hit with spell attacks). The spellbook has the following wizard spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, light, mage hand, message, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): mage armor, magic missile, shield 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, mirror image 3rd level (3 slots): glyph of warding, dispel magic 4th level (3 slots): Otiluke's resilient sphere, polymorph 5th level (2 slots): animate objects, Bigby's hand 6th level (1 slots): globe of invulnerability

id-00004.name: Transpose Arcana
id-00004.desc: As a bonus action, the spell book can expend one spell slot, causing an allied spellcaster to regain a spell slot of that level or lower.

id-00001.name: Paper Cut
id-00001.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one creature. Hit: 13 (3d8) slashing damage.

id-00002.name: Mana Burn (Recharge 5-6)
id-00002.desc: The spellbook can expend one spell slot to deal force damage to a target within 60 feet of it. The damage is 18 (4d8) for a 1st-level spell slot, plus 9 (2d8) for each spell level higher than 1st. The target must make a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw, taking full damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

wartitan.name: War Titan
wartitan.damageresistances: bludgeoning, piercing, slashing from nonmagical weapons

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
id-00001.desc: If the titan fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00002.name: Magic Resistance
id-00002.desc: The titan has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00003.name: Magic Weapons
id-00003.desc: The titan's weapon attacks are magical.

id-00004.name: Well-Armed
id-00004.desc: The titan can take one reaction on every turn in a combat.

id-00001.name: Parry
id-00001.desc: The titan gains +5 AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the titan must see the attacker and be wielding a melee weapon.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The titan makes two melee weapon attacks.

id-00002.name: Longsword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +12 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 18 (2d10 + 7) slashing damage.

id-00003.name: Blade Storm (Recharge 5-6)
id-00003.desc: The titan swings its weapons in a whirlwind of steel. Each creature within 10 feet of the titan must make a DC 20 Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 (4d8) bludgeoning damage, and 18 (4d8) piercing damage, and 18 (4d8) slashing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful save.

id-00001.name: Parry
id-00001.desc: The titan can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The titan regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Attack
id-00002.desc: The titan makes one attack.

id-00003.name: War Cry (costs 2 actions)
id-00003.desc: Each creature within 120 feet of the titan that can hear it must succeed on a DC 16 Wisdom saving throw or take 10 (4d4) psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

id-00004.name: Hold the Line (Costs 2 actions)
id-00004.desc: The titan gains 26 (4d12) temporary hit points.

id-00001.name: Water Susceptibility
id-00001.desc: For ever 5 feet the bear moves in water, or for every gallon of water splashed on it, it takes 1 cold damge.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The bear makes two attacks: One with its bite and one with its claws.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d8 + 5) piercing damage plus 3 (1d6) fire damage.

id-00003.name: Claws
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d6 + 5) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Fire Breath (Recharge 5-6)
id-00004.desc: The bear exhales a blast of flames in a 15-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 12 Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 (5d6) fire damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Acidic Blood
id-00001.desc: A creature that hits the crawler with a melee attack while within 5 ft of it takes 7 (2d6) acid damage.

id-00002.name: Caustic Fumes
id-00002.desc: Any creature that starts its turn within 10 feet of the crawler must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the start of its next turn. On a successful saving throw, the creature is immune to the crawler's fumes for 24 hours.

id-00001.name: Claws
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 12 (2d8 + 3) slashing damage plus 7 (2d6) acid damage.

id-00002.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
id-00002.desc: The crawler spits acid in a line that is 30 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a DC 14 Dexterity saving throw, taking 28 (8d6) acid damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

evildoll.name: Evil Doll
evildoll.damageresistances: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons that aren't silvered
evildoll.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned

id-00001.name: Acid Spray (Recharge 6)
id-00001.desc: Devil's Sight. Magical darkness doesn't impede the doll's darkvision.

id-00002.name: Inanimate
id-00002.desc: While the doll remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary doll.

id-00003.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00003.desc: The doll's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save DC 14). The doll can innately cast the following spells, requiring only verbal components: At will: suggestion 1/day each: dominate person, modify memory

id-00004.name: Undying Evil
id-00004.desc: If the doll is destroyed, it regains all its hitpoints and reappears at a nearby location in 24 hours unless a remove curse spell is cast on its remains.

id-00001.name: Giggle
id-00001.desc: One creature of the doll's choice within 30 feet of it must succeed on a DC 14 Wisdom saving throw or take 7 (2d6) psychic damage and become frightened for 1 minute. The target can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, with disadvantage if the doll is within line of sight, ending the effect on itself on a success.

id-00001.name: Amphibious
id-00001.desc: The gill-man can breathe air and water.

id-00002.name: Regeneration
id-00002.desc: The gill-man regains 10 hit points at the start of its turn. If the gill-man is poisoned, this trait doesn't function. If the gill-man takes poison damage, this trait doesn't function at the start of the gill-man's next turn. The gi ll-man dies only if it starts its turn with O hit points and doesn 't regenerate. Swimby. The gill-man doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it swims out of an enemy's reach.

id-00003.name: Torpedo Attack
id-00003.desc: If the gill-man swims at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 9 (2d8) damage to the target.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The gill-man makes two attacks with its claws.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +8 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) slashing damage.

id-00001.name: Aggressive
id-00001.desc: As a bonus action, the killer can move up to its speed toward a hostile creature that it can see.

id-00002.name: Ambusher
id-00002.desc: The killer has advantage on attack rolls against any creature it has surprised.

id-00003.name: Relentless (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
id-00003.desc: If the killer takes 20 damage or less that would reduce it to 0 hit points, it is reduced to 1 hit point instead.

id-00004.name: Surprise Attack
id-00004.desc: If the killer surprises a creature and hits it with an attack during the first round of combat, the target takes an extra 14 (4d6) damage from the attack.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The killer makes three melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Shortsword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 ( 1d6+4) piercing damage. If the target is a creature other than an undead or a construct, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or lose 5 (1d10) hit points at the start of each of its turns due to a bleeding wound. Each time the killer hits the wounded target with this attack, the damage dealt by the wound increases by 5 (1d10). Any creature can take an action to stanch the wound with a successful DC 14 Wisdom (Medicine) check. The wound also closes if the target receives magical healing.

headlesshorseman.name: Headless Horseman
headlesshorseman.languages: understands Common, Abyssal, and Infernal but can't speak

id-00001.name: Mounted Combatant
id-00001.desc: The horseman can force an attack targeted at its mount to target itself instead.

id-00002.name: Ride-By
id-00002.desc: While mounted, the horseman and its mount don't provoke opportunity attacks when they move out of an enemy's reach.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The horseman makes two melee attacks.

id-00002.name: Vorpal Longsword
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack:+ 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) slashing damage. When the horseman rolls a 20 on the attack roll, if the damage would reduce the creature to 0 hit points, the horseman cuts off the creature's head. Jack-o'-lantern (Recharge 6). Ranged Weapon Attack:+ 7 to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. Hit: 13 (2d8 + 4) bludgeoning damage plus 14 (4d6) fire damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw or become stunned until the end of the horseman's next turn.

text.p: A headless horseman always hunts for heads while riding its mount. Some may be found riding a living or skeletal warhorse. Particularly powerful horsemen ride dread steeds, hellish mounts that invoke as much fear as their riders. A dread steed uses the statistics of a nightmare, except that it has no fly speed.

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (3/day)
id-00001.desc: If the king fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The king makes two slam attacks.

id-00002.name: Slam
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (2d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Squash
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack:+ 11 to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 15 (2d8 + 6) bludgeoning damage. The target must succeed on a DC 19 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

id-00004.name: Gourd
id-00004.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +11 to hit, range 60/240 ft., one target. Hit: 28 (4d10 + 6) bludgeoning damage.

id-00005.name: Seed Spit (Recharge 5-6)
id-00005.desc: The king spits pumpkin seeds in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw, taking 45 (1 Od8) piercing damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Seed Spit (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The king can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The king regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Squash
id-00002.desc: The king makes a squash attack.

id-00003.name: Vine Lash (Costs 2 Actions)
id-00003.desc: The king lashes out with entangling vines. Each enemy creature within 20 feet of the king must succeed on a DC 19 Dexterity saving throw or become restrained. A creature restrained by the vines can use its action to make a DC 19 Strength check, freeing itself on a success. The vines can also be attacked and destroyed (AC 12; hp 20; vulnerability to slashing damage).

id-00004.name: Trick or Treat (Costs 3 Actions)
id-00004.desc: The king scatters up to three pumpkins, which fall in unoccupied spaces within 20 feet of the king. Each pumpkin then polymorphs into any kind of creature whose challenge rating is 4 or less, and acts as an ally of its king. The creatures revert to ordinary pumpkins when destroyed. The king can't control more than three polymorphed pumpkins at a time.

id-00001.name: Dive Attack
id-00001.desc: If the ape is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 7 (2d6) damage to the target.

id-00002.name: Monkey Grip
id-00002.desc: The ape can wield a two-handed weapon in one hand.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The ape makes two attacks: one with its fist and one with its greatsword.

id-00002.name: Fist
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6+3) bludgeoning damage.

id-00003.name: Greatsword
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6+3) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Rock
id-00004.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, range 25/50 ft., one target. Hit: 6 (1d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage.

id-00001.name: Innate Spellcasting
id-00001.desc: The feyote's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. The feyote can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components: At will: druidcraft 1/day: enhance ability 1/week: divination

id-00002.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
id-00002.desc: The feyote has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

id-00003.name: Magic Resistance
id-00003.desc: The feyote has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00001.name: Bite
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6 + 1) piercing damage. If the target is a creature, it must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or be knocked prone.

text.p: Innate Spellcasting. The feyote's innate spellcasting ability is Wisdom. The feyote can innately cast the following spells, requiring no components:

id-00001.name: Sure-Footed
id-00001.desc: The scorpikis has advantage on Strength and Dexterity saving th rows made against effects that would knock it prone.

id-00001.name: Parry
id-00001.desc: The scorpikis adds 3 to its AC against one melee attack that would hit it. To do so, the scorpikis must see the attacker.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The scorpikis makes three attacks: two with its claws and one with its sting. It can make a glaive attack in place of a claw attack.

id-00002.name: Claw
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (1d8+4) bludgeoning damage, and the target is grappled (escape DC 14). The scorpikis has two claws, each of which can grapple only one target.

id-00003.name: Glaive
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, reach 10ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) slashing damage.

id-00004.name: Sting
id-00004.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +7 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (1d10 + 4) piercing damage, and the target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 22 (4d10) poison damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

id-00001.name: Spellcasting
id-00001.desc: The chronomancer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The chronomancer has the following wizard sells prepared: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, mage hand, ray of frost, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, expeditious retreat, magic missile, shield 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, misty step 3rd level (3 slots): blink, haste, slow 4th level (3 slots): banishment, dimension door 5th level (1 slot): cone of cold

id-00001.name: Slow Projectile
id-00001.desc: If the chronomancer is targeted by a ranged attack, it can alter the flow of time nearby, causing incoming projectiles to slow down. Until the start of its next turn, the chronomancer has a +10 bonus to AC against ranged attacks.

id-00001.name: Unmake
id-00001.desc: The chronomancer choses one creature it can see within 60 feet of it, causing the target's flesh to rapidly age and decompose. The target must make a DC 14 Constitution saving throw, taking 16 (3d10) necrotic damage on a fai led save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

text.p: The chronomancer is a 9th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 14, +6 to hit with spell attacks). The chronomancer has the following wizard sells prepared:

id-00001.name: Magic Resistance
id-00001.desc: The chronomancer has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

id-00002.name: Spellcasting
id-00002.desc: The chronomancer is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The chronomancer has the following wizard sells prepared: Cantrips (at will): blade ward, mage hand, ray of frost, prestidigitation 1st level (4 slots): detect magic, expeditious retreat, magic missile, shield 2nd level (3 slots): hold person, misty step 3rd level (3 slots): blink, haste, slow 4th level (3 slots): banishment, dimension door 5th level (3 slots): cone of cold, wall of force 6th level (1 slot): globe of invulnerability 7th level (1 slot): teleport 8th level (1 slot): maze 9th level (1 slot): time stop

id-00003.name: Stretch Time (Recharge 5-6)
id-00003.desc: The chronomancer can take one additional action on its turn.

id-00001.name: Rewind
id-00001.desc: When the chronomancer or another creature makes an attack roll, saving throw, or ability check, it must remake the roll and use the new result.

id-00001.name: Expose Paradox (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The chronomancer choses one creature it can see within 60 feet of it, revealing to it a paradox in the space-time continuum. The target must make a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw, taking 42 (12d6) psychic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

text.p: The chronomancer is a 20th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Intelligence (save DC 18, +10 to hit with spell attacks). The chronomancer has the following wizard sells prepared:

id-00001.name: Dive Attack
id-00001.desc: If the hawkfox is flying and dives at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hits it with a melee weapon attack, the attack deals an extra 9 (2d8) damage to the target.

id-00002.name: Keen Sight and Smell
id-00002.desc: The hawkfox has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight or smell.

id-00003.name: Nimble Action
id-00003.desc: On each of its turns, the hawkfox can use a bonus action to take the Dash or Disengage action.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The hawkfox makes one bite attack and one talon attack.

id-00002.name: Bite
id-00002.desc: Me/ee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 7 (1d8 + 3) piercing damage.

id-00003.name: Talons
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 8 (2d4 + 3) piercing damage.

id-00001.name: Cunning Action
id-00001.desc: On each of its turns, the stalker can use a bonus action to take the Dash, Disengage, or Hide action.

id-00002.name: Deadly Aim
id-00002.desc: The stalker deals an extra 9 (2d8) damage when it hits with a ranged weapon attack (included in the attack). Additionally, its ranged attacks ignore half cover and threequarters cover.

id-00003.name: Silent Sniper
id-00003.desc: When the stalker is hidden from a creature, making a ranged weapon attack doesn't reveal its position.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The stalker makes three ranged attacks.

id-00002.name: Longbow
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: + 7 to hit, range 150/600 ft., one target. Hit: 17 (3d8 + 4) piercing damage.

werewolfalpha.name: Werewolf Alpha
werewolfalpha.actext: (armor scraps) in humanoid form, 16 (natural armor) in wolf or hybrid form
werewolfalpha.damageimmunities: bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage from nonmagica l weapons that aren't silvered

id-00001.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
id-00001.desc: If the werewolf fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

id-00002.name: Keen Hearing and Smell
id-00002.desc: The werewolf has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on hearing or smell.

id-00003.name: Pack Leader
id-00003.desc: The werewolf's allies have advantage on melee attack rolls against any hostile creature within 5 feet of the werewolf.

id-00004.name: Shapechanger
id-00004.desc: The werewolf can use its action to polymorph into a wolf-humanoid hybrid or into a wolf, or back into its true form, which is humanoid. Its statistics, other than its AC, are the same in each form. Any equipment it is wearing or carrying isn't transformed. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

id-00001.name: Multiattack (Hybrid Form Only)
id-00001.desc: The werewolf makes three attacks: one with its bite and two with its claws.

id-00002.name: Bite (Wolf or Hybrid Form Only)
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 14 (2d8 + 5) piercing damage. If the target is a humanoid, it must succeed on a DC 14 Constitution saving throw or be cursed with werewolf lycanthropy.

id-00003.name: Claws (Hybrid Form Only)
id-00003.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +9 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 16 (2d1 O + 5) slashing damage.

id-00001.name: Claws (Hybrid Form Only)
id-00001.desc: The werewolf can take 3 legendary actions, choosing from the options below. Only one legendary action option can be used at a time and only at the end of another creature's turn. The werewolf regains spent legendary actions at the start of its turn.

id-00002.name: Leap
id-00002.desc: The werewolf moves up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

id-00003.name: Bark Orders
id-00003.desc: The werewolf chooses a friendly creature who can see or hear it. That creature can use its reaction to move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

id-00004.name: Frenzy (Costs 2 Actions)
id-00004.desc: The werewolf can make one claw attack against each creature within 5 feet of it.

chainergeist.name: Chainer Geist
chainergeist.damageresistances: acid, fire, lightning, thunder; bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing from nonmagical weapons
chainergeist.conditionimmunities: charmed, exhaustion, frightened, grappled, paralyzed, petrified, poisoned, prone, restrained
chainergeist.languages: any languages it knew in life

id-00001.name: Ethereal Sight
id-00001.desc: The geist can see 60 feet into the Ethereal Plane when it is on the Material plane, and vice versa.

id-00002.name: Incorporeal Movement
id-00002.desc: The geist can move through other creatures and objects as if they were difficult terrain. It takes 5 (1d10) force damage if it ends its turn inside an object.

id-00001.name: Multiattack
id-00001.desc: The geist makes two attacks with its chains.

id-00002.name: Chain
id-00002.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +5 to hit, reach 1 Oft., one target. Hit: 10 (2d6 + 3) bludgeoning damage. The target is grappled (escape DC 13) if the geist isn't already grappling a creature. Until this grapple ends, the target is restra ined and takes 3 (1d6) necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns.

id-00003.name: Etherealness
id-00003.desc: The geist enters the Ethereal Plane from the Material Plane, or vice versa. It is visible on the Material Plane while it is in the Border Ethereal, and vice versa, yet it can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

id-00001.name: Force Field (Recharge 5-6)
id-00001.desc: The technothug adds 4 to its AC against one attack that would hit it. To do so, the technothug must see the attacker.

id-00001.name: Pistol Whip
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 5 (1d6 + 2) bludgeoning damage.

id-00002.name: Laser Pistol
id-00002.desc: Ranged Weapon Attack: +4 to hit, range 40/120 ft., one target. Hit: 9 (2d6 + 2) radiant damage.

id-00001.name: Amphibious
id-00001.desc: The bullywug can breathe air and water.

id-00002.name: Speak with Frogs and Toads
id-00002.desc: The bullywug can communicate simple concepts to frogs and toads when it speaks in Bullywug.

id-00003.name: Spellcasting (Bullywug Form Only)
id-00003.desc: The bullywug is a 5th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (save DC 12, +4 to hit with spell attacks). The bullywug has the following druid spells prepared: Cantrips (at will): druidcraft, shape water, shillelagh 1st level (4 slots): fog cloud, create or destroy water, cure wounds 2nd level (3 slots): invisibility, misty step 3rd level (2 slots): tidal wave, wall of water

id-00004.name: Swamp Camouflage
id-00004.desc: The bullywug has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks made to hide in swampy terrain.

id-00005.name: Standing Leap
id-00005.desc: The bullywug's long jump is up to 20 feet and its high jump is up to 10 feet, with or without a running start.

id-00001.name: Mace
id-00001.desc: Melee Weapon Attack: +3 to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 4 (1d6+1) bludgeoning damage.

id-00002.name: Change Shape (Recharges after a Short or Long Rest)
id-00002.desc: The bullywug magically polymorphs into a giant toad, remaining in that form for up to 1 hour. It can revert to its true form as a bonus action. Its statistics are replaced by the statistics of a giant toad, but it retains its Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores. Any equipment it is wearing merges into the new form. It reverts to its true form if it dies.

typeforeclawsorbat_likewingsgrowalongmor.description: Foreclaws Or Bat-like Wings Grow Along Morphlits As They Travel, Granting Them Easy Access To Even The Most Difficult Of Terrain. Morphlits Share A Complex Hivemind, Which Was Given To Them At Their Creation. Small Hierarchies Concerning Shape And Personality Emerge From Each Form A Morphlit Takes. Winged Morphlits Take On An Observer Role In Their Society. Burrowing Morhplits Are More Aggressive

morphlit.source: foreclaws or bat-like wings grow along Morphlits as they travel, granting them easy access to even the most difficult of terrain. Morphlits share a complex hivemind, which was given to them at their creation. Small hierarchies concerning shape and personality emerge from each form a Morphlit takes. Winged Morphlits take on an observer role in their society. Burrowing Morhplits are more aggressive
